commit_message:
Pecan: Define plugin crud methods in base class

Refactors the current pecan code to use predefined methods to get
the plugin methods the controllers will call.  This also adds in
parent resource information to build those method names, but parent
support will not be complete until a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I4e0e6ef96364991a9393bc5fba495e37dade68a1
Closes-Bug: #1596754

subject: Fix concurrency issue with Python 3.4 test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 19:35:05.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/util/util.py'], 'message': 'Fix concurrency issue with Python 3.4 test

We have been seeing failures in parallel Py34
tests caused by the test database being set up more
than once.
The existing mechanism is not thread-safe.
Add a lock around the database setup to ensure
the it is ever executed by only one thread.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I68aba50d60b912384080911a6f78283f027c4ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix concurrency issue with Python 3.4 test

We have been seeing failures in parallel Py34
tests caused by the test database being set up more
than once.
The existing mechanism is not thread-safe.
Add a lock around the database setup to ensure
the it is ever executed by only one thread.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I68aba50d60b912384080911a6f78283f027c4ee3

subject: Skip unavailable hosts when distributing keys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 11:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_key_distribute.yml'], 'message': "Skip unavailable hosts when distributing keys

The 'Create authorized keys file from host vars' task assumes that every
host within the nova_compute group is available. If any host within that
group is offline, excluded through a limit, or has otherwise failed an
earlier task, it will lead to this task failing for every host.

Add a when clause checking for the existence of the nova_pubkey hostvar
so that the task and remainder of the role can continue when a
nova_compute host is unavailable.

Related-Bug: 1531783
Change-Id: Idec01d13c35632204a2ae0f0a848a0ccc5b34d73
(cherry picked from commit 8600a80930b53bae358658b51dbf4cce1628685f)
"}]
commit_message:
Skip unavailable hosts when distributing keys

The 'Create authorized keys file from host vars' task assumes that every
host within the nova_compute group is available. If any host within that
group is offline, excluded through a limit, or has otherwise failed an
earlier task, it will lead to this task failing for every host.

Add a when clause checking for the existence of the nova_pubkey hostvar
so that the task and remainder of the role can continue when a
nova_compute host is unavailable.

Related-Bug: 1531783
Change-Id: Idec01d13c35632204a2ae0f0a848a0ccc5b34d73
(cherry picked from commit 8600a80930b53bae358658b51dbf4cce1628685f)

If we try to delete a VM and to delete the floating IP
associated with the VM at the same time, depending
on the order according to which these requests are processed
Neutron might fail in the deletion of the floating IP,
raising a PortNotFound error. This happens because Neutron
notifies Nova of the network change event and it tries to get

commit_message:
When deleting floating IP catch PortNotFound

If we try to delete a VM and to delete the floating IP
associated with the VM at the same time, depending
on the order according to which these requests are processed
Neutron might fail in the deletion of the floating IP,
raising a PortNotFound error. This happens because Neutron
notifies Nova of the network change event and it tries to get
the port to which the FIP is associated. If the port is not there,
Neutron shouldn't raise, it shouldn't send any notification.

Conflicts:
	neutron/notifiers/nova.py
	neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_nova.py

Closes-bug: #1586931
Change-Id: Ic72313ad1f787b3cb528e806c843f1fd01eb12f2
(cherry picked from commit 6e275e38575981386508718bf31e6f88b5a0887d)

commit_message:
When deleting floating IP catch PortNotFound

If we try to delete a VM and to delete the floating IP
associated with the VM at the same time, depending
on the order according to which these requests are processed
Neutron might fail in the deletion of the floating IP,
raising a PortNotFound error. This happens because Neutron
notifies Nova of the network change event and it tries to get
the port to which the FIP is associated. If the port is not there,
Neutron shouldn't raise, it shouldn't send any notification.

Conflicts:
	neutron/notifiers/nova.py
	neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_nova.py

Closes-bug: #1586931
Change-Id: Ic72313ad1f787b3cb528e806c843f1fd01eb12f2
(cherry picked from commit 6e275e38575981386508718bf31e6f88b5a0887d)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 17:29:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_mongodb_users.yml'], 'message': 'Update mongodb bootstrap tasks

When deploying on hosts with PyMongo version > 3.0, as found
on Xenial hosts, The bootstrap playbook will fail due to the
following error:

  'The localhost login exception only allows the first admin account to be created'

To resolve this error a "root" user create and password setup
has been added to the tasks and the required login credentials
have been passed to the ceilometer and aodh tasks.

Change-Id: Iaa29b4256dd4b3ac0774a05fc55f5b845ee57732
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update mongodb bootstrap tasks

When deploying on hosts with PyMongo version > 3.0, as found
on Xenial hosts, The bootstrap playbook will fail due to the
following error:

  'The localhost login exception only allows the first admin account to be created'

To resolve this error a "root" user create and password setup
has been added to the tasks and the required login credentials
have been passed to the ceilometer and aodh tasks.

Change-Id: Iaa29b4256dd4b3ac0774a05fc55f5b845ee57732
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Adding improved logging to amphora rest driver

We are seeing odd behavior connecting to the amphora on some
gate hosts.  This patch adds additional logging to gather
information on this behavior as well as provide more user
friendly log messages when connection issues occur.

Change-Id: I086fd64cfadb839eec36128016ee018e373f9457

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 21:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_pure.py'], 'message': 'Fix failure with "None" volume type in Pure drivers

We were not checking if the type id was None before calling
the util method to get the volume type. Turns out the helper
will raise an exception if the type is None (intentionally).

This fixes the issue by checking first in the driver before
using the util method\x10. Added unit test coverage for this
scenario as well.

Change-Id: Ie3c7b56fafb4a8c07853a9c1cd11e7e26444bdc1
Closes-Bug: #1600362
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failure with "None" volume type in Pure drivers

We were not checking if the type id was None before calling
the util method to get the volume type. Turns out the helper
will raise an exception if the type is None (intentionally).

This fixes the issue by checking first in the driver before
using the util method. Added unit test coverage for this
scenario as well.

Change-Id: Ie3c7b56fafb4a8c07853a9c1cd11e7e26444bdc1
Closes-Bug: #1600362

commit_message:
Enable CRUD for trunk ports

This patch enables basic CRUD operations on trunk ports and defines
related API extensions. Trunk ports and sub-ports can be persisted
in the Neutron model and are made visible through the API, but the
L2 agent is not notified and no trunk ports or subports are actually
instantiated on compute hosts.

This one of the main patches in the series that implement the end
to end functionality.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I26453eb9a1b25e116193417271400994ac57e4c1

commit_message:
Fix string interpolation to delayed to be handled by the logging code

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging
code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
See the oslo i18n guideline.
* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: I3fa26c1c5c672d5505fa556e03af35318f4774ab
Closes-Bug: #1596829

subject: Fix secure method to work with PXC
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-07 00:41:44.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/galera_common/service.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/user_actions_runners.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/manager.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py', 'trove/tests/int_tests.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/pxc/service.py'], 'message': "Fix secure method to work with PXC

When PXC was implemented, the secure method was overridden as the
stock one was causing problems on prepare. This issue seems to
be caused by the order of work done in the call. If the admin
user is set up first and then used to delete the anon users,
everything works for all flavors of MySQL.

Tested using the scenario tests on MySQL, Percona, PXC and MariaDB.

Also cleaned up some of the common code and made the connection URL
more resilient to special password characters. Updated the 'supported'
tests and fixed the user actions one to work with PXC.

Change-Id: Idf9a096b8870e428090454528b79930f3d2fd760
Closes-Bug: #1585355
"}]
commit_message:
Fix secure method to work with PXC

When PXC was implemented, the secure method was overridden as the
stock one was causing problems on prepare. This issue seems to
be caused by the order of work done in the call. If the admin
user is set up first and then used to delete the anon users,
everything works for all flavors of MySQL.

Tested using the scenario tests on MySQL, Percona, PXC and MariaDB.

Also cleaned up some of the common code and made the connection URL
more resilient to special password characters. Updated the 'supported'
tests and fixed the user actions one to work with PXC.

Change-Id: Idf9a096b8870e428090454528b79930f3d2fd760
Closes-Bug: #1585355

This patch addresses the issue by calculating dpid_str
value from cached dpid instead of referencing unassigned
variable.
Some minor refactor also took place.

(cherry-picked from commit b22c7ae42813ca7c9c791b5acd4da24566784e9c)

Change-Id: If50183bf95cbe50c3a2393be8c2ab913c9715a10

commit_message:
OVS: UnboundLocalError on switch timeout fixed

In case there is some cached datapath id in OVSAgentBridge
and openflow switch does not respond in time for some
reason, a call to OVSAgentBridge._dpid() method will result
in UnboundLocalError.
This patch addresses the issue by calculating dpid_str
value from cached dpid instead of referencing unassigned
variable.
Some minor refactor also took place.

Closes-Bug: #1588042
(cherry-picked from commit b22c7ae42813ca7c9c791b5acd4da24566784e9c)

Change-Id: If50183bf95cbe50c3a2393be8c2ab913c9715a10

subject: Ensure that gate test does not remove ~/.ansible/tmp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 10:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Ensure that gate test does not remove ~/.ansible/tmp

As zuul uses Ansible the ~/.ansible directory is populated with
artifacts which zuul uses to facilitate the job execution.

This patch ensures that the execution of tests does not remove
the whole ~/.ansible directory, but instead only removes the

Change-Id: I3681b1a322faf7226236fb4f5db8b0308f8fd9b9

commit_message:
Ensure that gate test does not remove ~/.ansible/tmp

As zuul uses Ansible the ~/.ansible directory is populated with
artifacts which zuul uses to facilitate the job execution.

This patch ensures that the execution of tests does not remove
the whole ~/.ansible directory, but instead only removes the
parts which we populate.

Change-Id: I3681b1a322faf7226236fb4f5db8b0308f8fd9b9

subject: Cache neutron extension lookup state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 10:16:59.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/network/drivers/neutron/test_base.py', 'octavia/network/drivers/neutron/base.py'], 'message': "Cache neutron extension lookup state

I don't believe that neutron extensions are loaded/unloaded on the fly,
so there should be no reason to check them every time (this adds
additional API call overhead). It is trivial to cache them instead.
If people think this is a bad idea for some reason I have not
considered, feel free to -2 (maybe my assumption is incorrect).

Change-Id: Ifa08bea3187eb1f603a28c7faf33dfbaff6f6afe
"}]
commit_message:
Cache neutron extension lookup state

I don't believe that neutron extensions are loaded/unloaded on the fly,
so there should be no reason to check them every time (this adds
additional API call overhead). It is trivial to cache them instead.
If people think this is a bad idea for some reason I have not
considered, feel free to -2 (maybe my assumption is incorrect).

Change-Id: Ifa08bea3187eb1f603a28c7faf33dfbaff6f6afe

- mock_destroy should be fake.FakeDriver.destroy not
driver.ComputeDriver.destroy (the latter is never actually hit by the
test, the former is)
- mock_macs_for_instance is never hit by the two tests that mock it
because the method that calls it is also mocked, so just remove those

commit_message:
Fixing a few more ComputeDriver mocks

- mock_destroy should be fake.FakeDriver.destroy not
driver.ComputeDriver.destroy (the latter is never actually hit by the
test, the former is)
- mock_macs_for_instance is never hit by the two tests that mock it
because the method that calls it is also mocked, so just remove those
two mocks entirely

Change-Id: I76f1830b32989b85b2c014d77dbe199013e68adf

commit_message:
Improve cleanup logic for trunk tests

This patch changes the cleanup logic for trunk tests
by explicitly deleting trunk resources rather than
relying on the implicit port delete cascading policy.

This makes the tests more robust to business rules
changes where a port deletion may end up being
prevented should a trunk be in use.

Change-Id: If6197b8b167ad3f0fdb2c10f05d10ac019acf648

Since a network can now be broken up by segments, each segment will
need to have its own DHCP Agent.  This maintains backwards

commit_message:
DHCP Agent scheduling with segments

Since a network can now be broken up by segments, each segment will
need to have its own DHCP Agent.  This maintains backwards
compatibility when a network does not have a segment. However,
once a segment is created on a network, a dhcp agent should be
scheduled per segment with a dhcp enabled subnet.

The scheduling happens by filtering the candidate dhcp agents by
the hosts that are bound to that segment.

Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

Change-Id: If73211978e14b7533a1213cfb8c2c155a408f19e

commit_message:
Insert validation with request params for HTTP DELETE

When delete request is thrown with "request body", it returns 500.
This commit fixes the return code from 500 to 400(BadRequest).

Change-Id: Iadf1bc724f9bd1728d3f9d3c0da4f0675da97d30
Closes-Bug: #1519342

commit_message:
neutron-db-manage: revision: fail for --autogenerate and branch

If branch specification (--expand/--contract) is passed to CLI while
also passing --autogenerate, fail explicitly instead of going into
autogeneration code and generating both scripts, as we currently do.

Change-Id: Ibf829fdd0b66a8d312c314487cfd8122a7721ef6
Related-bug: #1501380
(cherry picked from commit 8d07ba0e1b46dfcb588925c6320d7c0c5225a315)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-09 13:43:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/callbacks/exceptions.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/callbacks/version_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/callbacks/test_version_manager.py', 'doc/source/devref/rpc_callbacks.rst', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agents_db.py'], 'message': 'Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism

The previous version depended on the AgentDbMixin to be loaded by
any plugin, and also introduced an __init__ on the mixin which
was problematic: mixins are expected to be classes which add methods
to another class, but to implement no constructor. One of the plugins
had one of the elements of MRO not calling to super().__init__ and
hence not triggering this __init__ method.

This change requires the plugins using the rpc callback mechanism
to provide the AgentDbMixin which is used to refresh cache of known
resource consumers (agents) and versions on demand, this way
we make it more clear that the rpc_callback api is currently designed
to be used with agents only, despite of its extensibility to other
areas.

Change-Id: Ie96b52dbe3a1f32cd4c11de8d8a5eff663fbf7f6
Related-Bug: #1584204
(cherry picked from commit 1d43dd217a31c38caf8ad3a695c0c262d63bb724)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism

The previous version depended on the AgentDbMixin to be loaded by
any plugin, and also introduced an __init__ on the mixin which
was problematic: mixins are expected to be classes which add methods
to another class, but to implement no constructor. One of the plugins
had one of the elements of MRO not calling to super().__init__ and
hence not triggering this __init__ method.

This change requires the plugins using the rpc callback mechanism
to provide the AgentDbMixin which is used to refresh cache of known
resource consumers (agents) and versions on demand, this way
we make it more clear that the rpc_callback api is currently designed
to be used with agents only, despite of its extensibility to other
areas.

Change-Id: Ie96b52dbe3a1f32cd4c11de8d8a5eff663fbf7f6
Related-Bug: #1584204
(cherry picked from commit 1d43dd217a31c38caf8ad3a695c0c262d63bb724)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 17:54:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Fetch router port subnets in bulk

When a router port is being attached to a network it
must first check that the new subnet(s) do not overlap
with any of the other subnets the router is already
attached to.

The previous code was calling the core plugin to look
up each attached subnet individually. This led to slow
responses if a router was attached to hundreds of other
subnets.

This patch just adjusts the logic to request all of the
subnets from the core plugin in one call so the number
of DB calls stays constant regardless of attached subnet
count.

Change-Id: I36a2b23b089269bb51ce3dc271c944b48fca8781
Closes-Bug: #1558101
(cherry picked from commit 9355885d7dab41e48a8ecaaf59b1bd3835f17f27)
'}]
commit_message:
Fetch router port subnets in bulk

When a router port is being attached to a network it
must first check that the new subnet(s) do not overlap
with any of the other subnets the router is already
attached to.

The previous code was calling the core plugin to look
up each attached subnet individually. This led to slow
responses if a router was attached to hundreds of other
subnets.

This patch just adjusts the logic to request all of the
subnets from the core plugin in one call so the number
of DB calls stays constant regardless of attached subnet
count.

Change-Id: I36a2b23b089269bb51ce3dc271c944b48fca8781
Closes-Bug: #1558101
(cherry picked from commit 9355885d7dab41e48a8ecaaf59b1bd3835f17f27)

subject: Scheduler: Allow a per-task customisable grace period
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-13 21:45:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'heat/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Scheduler: Allow a per-task customisable grace period

In some cases we may want to have different grace periods for different
tasks when we cancel a DependencyTaskGroup due to an error. This change
allows us to pass a function instead of just a value, so that we can
compute the correct grace period for each task.

Change-Id: I48842cc2a0193b8c3dc799f6e61c9243b0264b49
'}]
commit_message:
Scheduler: Allow a per-task customisable grace period

In some cases we may want to have different grace periods for different
tasks when we cancel a DependencyTaskGroup due to an error. This change
allows us to pass a function instead of just a value, so that we can
compute the correct grace period for each task.

Change-Id: I48842cc2a0193b8c3dc799f6e61c9243b0264b49

commit_message:
Updates supporting ironic-neutron integration

This patchset adds port creation with new optional parameters specifying
new port attributes (local_link_connection, pxe_enabled).
It also adds new parameter network_interface to node object.

Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko (vsaienko@mirantis.com)
Co-Authored-By: William Stevenson (will.stevenson@sap.com)

Partial-bug: #1526403
Depends-on: I67495196c3334f51ed034f4ca6e32a3e01a58f15

Change-Id: If2fb996783b9ac26a5bae2aadd6387207750def9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-16 00:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/mysql-config-preserve-types-77b970162bf6df08.yaml', 'trove/tests/unittests/configuration/test_configuration_controller.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_configuration.py', 'apidocs/src/samples/db-get-default-instance-configuration-response.json', 'trove/guestagent/common/guestagent_utils.py', 'trove/common/stream_codecs.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_operating_system.py', 'apidocs/src/samples/db-get-default-instance-configuration-response-json.txt', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_guestagent_utils.py'], 'message': 'Preserve data type when parsing MySQL configs

The data type information was lost in conversions.

IniCodec should deserialize Python objects (like other codecs).
guestagent_utils.to_bytes should return byte values as ints.

* The IniCodec is also used by Cassandra.
  Tested with both MySQL and Cassandra scenario tests.

Change-Id: Ib2fd527100e479172dd4dc38983354076e9ae9ab
Closes-Bug: 1599656
'}]
commit_message:
Preserve data type when parsing MySQL configs

The data type information was lost in conversions.

IniCodec should deserialize Python objects (like other codecs).
guestagent_utils.to_bytes should return byte values as ints.

* The IniCodec is also used by Cassandra.
  Tested with both MySQL and Cassandra scenario tests.

Change-Id: Ib2fd527100e479172dd4dc38983354076e9ae9ab
Closes-Bug: 1599656

commit_message:
WIP Add support for placement API to lib/nova

The placement service provides support for creating resource
providers, inventories and allocations.

For the time being the api is started when (and where) the nova-api
is started. By default placement-api application runs on port 8778
or under /placement when using mod-wsgi.

Change-Id: I48f615c2ec90aaff795a911f98071e43d296a03d
Depends-On: Ided59ecc3726c357ae76ce48251c066a5af20d0e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-14 19:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph'], 'message': "Use opt in package repo mirror in gate

OpenStack CI would prefer to not have the ceph repo package mirror
enabled by default for all jobs. Instead the mirror config will be
provided in a directory that apt won't read and can by copied/linked
into the dir that apt will read.

This gives testing greater flexibility and prevents growing dependencies
on non standard repos in jobs that don't intend on growing those
dependencies.

Change-Id: Icd87013fa74601268c19a8b79abf6b7baeaca9db
Depends-On: I410f45064080e1bb93684899028e9af34bd555a1
"}]
commit_message:
Use opt in package repo mirror in gate

OpenStack CI would prefer to not have the ceph repo package mirror
enabled by default for all jobs. Instead the mirror config will be
provided in a directory that apt won't read and can by copied/linked
into the dir that apt will read.

This gives testing greater flexibility and prevents growing dependencies
on non standard repos in jobs that don't intend on growing those
dependencies.

Change-Id: Icd87013fa74601268c19a8b79abf6b7baeaca9db
Depends-On: I410f45064080e1bb93684899028e9af34bd555a1

commit_message:
Skip ListImageFiltersTestJSON if snapshots are disabled

The ListImageFiltersTestJSON creates server snapshots
in resource_setup so it needs to check the compute-feature-enabled
snapshots flag for the tests to work (in case snapshots are
disabled in the cloud).

Change-Id: I6dcd3bab5cbf143c7fac23635835017dbbb9d802
Closes-Bug: #1603568

subject: [fix gate] Use upper-constraints on image build
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 18:30:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/files/elements/fedora-guest/install.d/15-reddwarf-dep', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-guest/extra-data.d/15-reddwarf-dep', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-guest/install.d/15-reddwarf-dep', 'scripts/files/elements/fedora-guest/extra-data.d/15-reddwarf-dep'], 'message': '[fix gate] Use upper-constraints on image build

Currently building an image uses requirements but not upper-constraints.
This can cause an issue when libraries change and the image becomes out
of sync with the server code (for example when oslo.context changes).

Trove integration now uses upper-constraints as well when building
images.

Change-Id: Iba5e9976ff9522b7b6fdd523ed78fc6d9b70ea6c
Closes-Bug: #1603506
'}]
commit_message:
[fix gate] Use upper-constraints on image build

Currently building an image uses requirements but not upper-constraints.
This can cause an issue when libraries change and the image becomes out
of sync with the server code (for example when oslo.context changes).

Trove integration now uses upper-constraints as well when building
images.

Change-Id: Iba5e9976ff9522b7b6fdd523ed78fc6d9b70ea6c
Closes-Bug: #1603506

commit_message:
Pecan: Implement pagination

Implements pagination and sorting in the QueryParametersHook. Doing
this in a hook keeps the main controller code clean and also doesn't
require implementing pagination and sorting in every controller.

Change-Id: I5f439cf2457984d6b62ce5fed9d5d471aafbde81
Closes-Bug: #1591338

commit_message:
Add ensure parameter to service identity resource

The service identity resource has ensure parameter that
defaults to 'present'. The new parameter will allow
removing resources that were created with the service
identity resource without having to write custom manifests.

Change-Id: I51b75baa84058779ca2c00f3ac2657c42831e51d
Closes-Bug: #1603394

subject: Check host group_names for group membership
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-15 10:09:07.000000000', 'files': ['templates/neutron.conf.j2', 'tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/plumgrid_config.yml', 'tasks/nuage_neutron_config.yml', 'tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'tasks/neutron_install-apt.yml', 'tasks/neutron_init.yml'], 'message': "Check host group_names for group membership

If a task only applies when a host is a member of a particular group,
check for the group in a host's 'group_names' rather than checking for
the name of the host in the group itself.

These are functionally the same check but, for the latter, a fatal error
can occur if any particular group does not exist at all within the
environment.

Change-Id: Ib64ae9454e228da2ea37bc6d2760857f399ccade
"}]
commit_message:
Check host group_names for group membership

If a task only applies when a host is a member of a particular group,
check for the group in a host's 'group_names' rather than checking for
the name of the host in the group itself.

These are functionally the same check but, for the latter, a fatal error
can occur if any particular group does not exist at all within the
environment.

Change-Id: Ib64ae9454e228da2ea37bc6d2760857f399ccade

commit_message:
authtoken: allow memcached_servers to be empty or os_service_default

Allow to set memcached_servers parameter to empty or to
os_service_default, and add some logic in the define to whether or not
configure the parameter and if yes, validate it's an array.

Change-Id: I4bd8cd22eafe6650511aa745fc400a6c4d36b512

commit_message:
Fix 500 error for showing deleted flavor details

Displaying deleted flavor details throws 500 internal server error.
Added 404 HttpNotFound status code in "@extension.expected_errors".

APIImpact: Return 404 status code for list extra specs
for a deleted flavor.

Closes-Bug: #1538896

Change-Id: Iba33296c28c3c3d6ba60052fe434107ac9c00c61

commit_message:
Switch _create_temp_cloned_volume in driver to VO

This commit updates _create_temp_cloned_volume and
_create_temp_volume_from_snapshot methods in driver.py
to use Volume object instead of SQLAlchemy model.

Related-Bug: #1602210
Change-Id: I17eab820fd2cbc004960ae75a2dd4cab6ab6e055

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-15 17:17:44.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/detection/plugins/kafka_consumer.py'], 'message': 'Kafka config naming conflict

The kafka config file was checking for redundancy with an un-unique variable name.
By passing in a unique name, the config file does not overwrite itself anymore.

Change-Id: I90f1dff9469af618ec71d2cb8ef245593448f7ce
'}]
commit_message:
Kafka config naming conflict

The kafka config file was checking for redundancy with an un-unique variable name.
By passing in a unique name, the config file does not overwrite itself anymore.

Change-Id: I90f1dff9469af618ec71d2cb8ef245593448f7ce

subject: Add exception handling for unavailable virsh
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-15 21:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/nova_compute_utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_utils.py'], 'message': 'Add exception handling for unavailable virsh

When virt-type is lxd libvirt-bin is not installed. The call to
destroy_libvirt_network fails because virsh is not available.

Add exception handling to destroy_libvirt_network when virt-type is lxd and
virsh is unavailable.

Closes-Bug: 1603566
Change-Id: I448598d5160c183de46938999db1c9d5232b80b2
'}]
commit_message:
Add exception handling for unavailable virsh

When virt-type is lxd libvirt-bin is not installed. The call to
destroy_libvirt_network fails because virsh is not available.

Add exception handling to destroy_libvirt_network when virt-type is lxd and
virsh is unavailable.

Closes-Bug: 1603566
Change-Id: I448598d5160c183de46938999db1c9d5232b80b2

commit_message:
Add name property to ENUM type

Postgresql ENUM type requires name property, Mysql is okay without it.
To be compatible with Postgresql, this patch adds name property to
columns of ENUM type.

Closes-Bug: #1597175

Change-Id: Ic22a4e445bd5f7c019deb37b99d820012f4848e6

subject: Increase indent level of doc top contents
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-23 09:47:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/css/combined.css'], 'message': 'Increase indent level of doc top contents

In the top contents of each document, it is not easy to distinguish
title levels because the current indent is 3px. It is a bit small.
This commit increases the indent level for second or more level of
titles.

Also aligns the Updated: <date> line with the page title.

margin-bottom is also unnecessary. It leads to unbalanced margin
when title level is changed.

Change-Id: I530afff51c814b96992a80a5daea8ebd81e51a53
'}]
commit_message:
Increase indent level of doc top contents

In the top contents of each document, it is not easy to distinguish
title levels because the current indent is 3px. It is a bit small.
This commit increases the indent level for second or more level of
titles.

Also aligns the Updated: <date> line with the page title.

margin-bottom is also unnecessary. It leads to unbalanced margin
when title level is changed.

Change-Id: I530afff51c814b96992a80a5daea8ebd81e51a53

subject: Update reference to charm-guide
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-15 15:03:50.000000000', 'files': ['src/README.md', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/__init__.py', '.gitignore', '.gitreview', 'unit_tests/__init__.py', 'src/metadata.yaml', 'src/test-requirements.txt', 'src/reactive/__init__.py', 'src/lib/charm/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Update reference to charm-guide

The charm-guide documentation is now published on
docs.openstack.org; update links for new location.

(also add .gitreview for first gerrit based change).

(also add __init__.py files to ensure py27 tests pass).

(also drop series in metadata as CI is not ready yet).

(add workaround for tox pep8 virtualenv build failure on 14.04).

commit_message:
Update reference to charm-guide

The charm-guide documentation is now published on
docs.openstack.org; update links for new location.

(also add .gitreview for first gerrit based change).

(also add __init__.py files to ensure py27 tests pass).

(also drop series in metadata as CI is not ready yet).

(add workaround for tox pep8 virtualenv build failure on 14.04).

(add patching for new features in charms_openstack).

Change-Id: I5088d5a27ebf18cbfe1f12af5e727ab83db66fd2

commit_message:
Pecan: move fields and filters logic to hooks

The logic for massaging the fields and filters data was being done in
the controllers.  This change pulls that logic out of the controllers
and puts it in a generic hook so that it's done for all controllers.
This will later be used for pagination, but thats not the main
motivation of this patch.

Ideally, the filters and fields would be passed into the controller
methods themselves as kwargs, but that is not easily done due to pecan
not easily allowing overriding the args and kwargs passed to the
controller methods. For now, the fields and filters will have to be
pulled out of the request context.

Change-Id: Ibea9087c7036faa064b87acb52e09c9a3c74148a

commit_message:
Fix authentication issue

Fix authentication issue if password is provided from tty prompt.
Set options.os_password to user input from prompt, as it gets
used to create auth object otherwise it will give authentication error.

Change-Id: I0246473f2165f1464d731e0ae9b4afa0b61dcbcc
Closes-Bug: #1575656

subject: OS_TENANT_NAME is not required when we have OS_PROJECT_NAME
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-07 07:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': 'OS_TENANT_NAME is not required when we have OS_PROJECT_NAME

Cinder support both v2 and v3 auth. Use v3 if possible.
In consideration of backwards compatibility, when we have
OS_PROJECT_NAME, the v2 auth should be ok because
tenant_name can be set by env[OS_PROJECT_NAME].


Change-Id: I9eed9c41a9deb5ecafa8d9e12f6d1b50d34f986d
Closes-Bug: #1588261
'}]
commit_message:
OS_TENANT_NAME is not required when we have OS_PROJECT_NAME

Cinder support both v2 and v3 auth. Use v3 if possible.
In consideration of backwards compatibility, when we have
OS_PROJECT_NAME, the v2 auth should be ok because
tenant_name can be set by env[OS_PROJECT_NAME].


Change-Id: I9eed9c41a9deb5ecafa8d9e12f6d1b50d34f986d
Closes-Bug: #1588261

commit_message:
NetApp: Add aggregate capacity info to scheduler

Customers have requested the NetApp cDOT drivers report aggregate
consumption metrics to the scheduler, so that custom filter and
goodness functions may be written to consider aggregate space.

Implements: blueprint netapp-report-aggregate-utilization
Change-Id: Ia43facb1c7e46b794e2cb2bb44b2174fe441e3f2

commit_message:
Ignore previous success if killing processes

When killing processes with -15 it could be different exit codes
but nothing prevents us to kill'em all with -9.

Change-Id: I05c94db0fb84026b8899245299ea89347aab724f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-13 14:38:08.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'convert wsgi REST logs to DEBUG verbosity

Based on observations in one of our large office deployments,
keystone/keystone-all.log is seeing is seeing on average multiple
log per second. These are logged at INFO verbosity which is the default
logging level in keystone.conf.

Most frequently seen logs:
<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO keystone.common.wsgi [-] GET /auth/tokens?

<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] <NUMBER> - -
[<DATE> <TIME>] "GET /v <NUMBER> /auth/tokens HTTP/ <NUMBER> " <NUMBER>
. <NUMBER>

Other high runner logs:
<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO keystone.common.wsgi [-] POST /tokens?POST
/tokens

<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] <NUMBER> - -
[<DATE> <TIME>] "POST /v <NUMBER> /tokens HTTP/ <NUMBER> " <NUMBER> .
<NUMBER>

<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO keystone.common.wsgi [-] GET /?
<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] <NUMBER> - -
[<DATE> <TIME>] "GET / HTTP/ <NUMBER> " <NUMBER> <NUMBER>

Note that eventlets were removed in Keystone post Mitaka therefore only
committing the wsgi piece of this commit. The eventlet logging fix may
be committed if patch back is required in previous releases.

Change-Id: Ic80fc6f45352909b1f11ceb0b7d20fdba85c2f75
Closes-Bug: #1590042
Signed-off-by: Kam Nasim <kam.nasim@windriver.com>
'}]
commit_message:
convert wsgi REST logs to DEBUG verbosity

Based on observations in one of our large office deployments,
keystone/keystone-all.log is seeing is seeing on average multiple
log per second. These are logged at INFO verbosity which is the default
logging level in keystone.conf.

Most frequently seen logs:
<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO keystone.common.wsgi [-] GET /auth/tokens?

<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] <NUMBER> - -
[<DATE> <TIME>] "GET /v <NUMBER> /auth/tokens HTTP/ <NUMBER> " <NUMBER>
. <NUMBER>

Other high runner logs:
<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO keystone.common.wsgi [-] POST /tokens?POST
/tokens

<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] <NUMBER> - -
[<DATE> <TIME>] "POST /v <NUMBER> /tokens HTTP/ <NUMBER> " <NUMBER> .
<NUMBER>

<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO keystone.common.wsgi [-] GET /?
<DATE> <TIME> <NUMBER> INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] <NUMBER> - -
[<DATE> <TIME>] "GET / HTTP/ <NUMBER> " <NUMBER> <NUMBER>

Note that eventlets were removed in Keystone post Mitaka therefore only
committing the wsgi piece of this commit. The eventlet logging fix may
be committed if patch back is required in previous releases.

Change-Id: Ic80fc6f45352909b1f11ceb0b7d20fdba85c2f75
Closes-Bug: #1590042
Signed-off-by: Kam Nasim <kam.nasim@windriver.com>

Modules currently are applied in any order, however operators may wish

This spec addresses this issue.

References: blueprint module-management-ordering
Change-Id: I12afa490033f018a8feda874b59e1e219ec96d4a

commit_message:
Add support for module ordering on apply

Modules currently are applied in any order, however operators may wish
to control the order that modules are applied to ensure proper
functionality.

This spec addresses this issue.

References: blueprint module-management-ordering
Change-Id: I12afa490033f018a8feda874b59e1e219ec96d4a

- invert dlrn repo injection and update order
- check if overcloud image is already available before trying to extract
- don't try to inject overcloud image if it wasn't extracted

commit_message:
Fixes for dlrn gate repo injection while using devmode

- invert dlrn repo injection and update order
- check if overcloud image is already available before trying to extract
- don't try to inject overcloud image if it wasn't extracted

Change-Id: Iee49ca5e08ece0917ee42d62054da0d0b6f9882c

For the moment, building manila configuration sample, we get real
hostname and IP address of host that runs "genconfig" tox job. It
should not be exposed. So, hide it using "sample_default" arg for
appropriate options.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id8e5bdbc352229cf6a908a545e23ce62fd162ca4
'}]
commit_message:
Do not put real hostname and IP address to manila config sample

For the moment, building manila configuration sample, we get real
hostname and IP address of host that runs "genconfig" tox job. It
should not be exposed. So, hide it using "sample_default" arg for
appropriate options.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id8e5bdbc352229cf6a908a545e23ce62fd162ca4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@gmail.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12193, 'name': 'Hisashi Osanai', 'email': 'osanai.hisashi@jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'ho'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-11 14:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_keystoneauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py'], 'message': 'Improve Keystone v3 token support

Now keystoneauth uses HTTP_X_TENANT_NAME/ID only even if v3 token uses for
backward compatibility. There is no problem with current behavior because
keystonemiddleware set same value on the headers but the headers are
specified as deprecated so this patch allows to support HTTP_X_PROJECT_NAME/ID
in addition to HTTP_X_TENANT_NAME/ID.

Change-Id: Ie5e02067a59e18f1ac215f51429863bdd42f729f
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Keystone v3 token support

Now keystoneauth uses HTTP_X_TENANT_NAME/ID only even if v3 token uses for
backward compatibility. There is no problem with current behavior because
keystonemiddleware set same value on the headers but the headers are
specified as deprecated so this patch allows to support HTTP_X_PROJECT_NAME/ID
in addition to HTTP_X_TENANT_NAME/ID.

Change-Id: Ie5e02067a59e18f1ac215f51429863bdd42f729f

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-14 23:20:38.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/network/drivers/neutron/allowed_address_pairs.py'], 'message': "Correct reraising of exception

When an exception is caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception was re-raised.

Co-Authored-By: Songming Yan <yan.songming@zte.com.cn>

Change-Id: I49f9847fbc0733b97a99637e2400f9dbb21182e3
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception is caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception was re-raised.

Co-Authored-By: Songming Yan <yan.songming@zte.com.cn>

Change-Id: I49f9847fbc0733b97a99637e2400f9dbb21182e3

commit_message:
Fix Freezer Agent Logging

Standardize on oslo.log.
Log exception stack traces where appropriate.
Add logging to all files.
Remove '[*]' from log messages.
Log command line arguments at Freezer Agent start
so that errors can be traced to specific invocations.

Leave scheduler module mostly unchanged because it
is doing python logging configuration.

Change-Id: I23de0558409e63978303963d592a4e5ee4dee2b5
(cherry picked from commit 00db2b0)

commit_message:
Fix variable name ENABLE_TEMPEST to UPGRADE_TEMPEST

It seems the intent is to upgrade tempest only if asked for[1][2]

This patch renames the ENABLE_TEMPEST variable to UPGRADE_TEMPEST to
avoid unnecessary tempest upgrade.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/grenade/blob/master/grenade.sh#L253--#L257
[2] https://github.com/openstack-dev/grenade/blob/master/grenade.sh#L306

Change-Id: I4c59f67bfb8dcba64b3d1d90b4ad5a4c134fa55a

subject: Fix bug for write-kube-os-config.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 06:41:04.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/write-kube-os-config.sh', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/write-kube-os-config.sh'], 'message': 'Fix bug for write-kube-os-config.sh

In file write-kube-os-config.sh, the bug is in line below
AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_URL" | tr -s "v3" "v2")
this command is used to change v3 to v2,but it will change any "3" to
"2". For example:
AUTH_URL=10.43.166.108:5000/v3
it will be changed to 10.42.166.108:5000/v2, where 43 is also changed
to 42.

Change-Id: Ia329b983ba59856783f2873722c9ade418d49cea
Closes-Bug: #1599703
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug for write-kube-os-config.sh

In file write-kube-os-config.sh, the bug is in line below
AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_URL" | tr -s "v3" "v2")
this command is used to change v3 to v2,but it will change any "3" to
"2". For example:
AUTH_URL=10.43.166.108:5000/v3
it will be changed to 10.42.166.108:5000/v2, where 43 is also changed
to 42.

Change-Id: Ia329b983ba59856783f2873722c9ade418d49cea
Closes-Bug: #1599703

subject: Replace "LOG.info(_" with "LOG.info(_LI"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 05:58:51.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/app.py'], 'message': 'Replace "LOG.info(_" with "LOG.info(_LI"

Follow http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html:
If a common message is not being used, they should each betreated
separately with respect to choosing a marker function.So this patch
is to fix it.

Change-Id: If7a74ce983ad0c7f4cab057cadd7d20ef3067fcd
Closes-Bug: #1600788
'}]
commit_message:
Replace "LOG.info(_" with "LOG.info(_LI"

Follow http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html:
If a common message is not being used, they should each betreated
separately with respect to choosing a marker function.So this patch
is to fix it.

Change-Id: If7a74ce983ad0c7f4cab057cadd7d20ef3067fcd
Closes-Bug: #1600788

subject: go: storage policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-06 19:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/swiftobjeng.go', 'go/probe/replicator_test.go', 'go/probe/auditor_test.go', 'go/objectserver/objengine_test.go', 'go/probe/combo_test.go', 'go/hummingbird/policy.go', 'go/hummingbird/policy_test.go', 'go/hummingbird/ring.go', 'go/probe/policy_test.go', 'go/objectserver/backend.go', 'go/probe/base.go', 'go/objectserver/objengine.go', 'go/objectserver/main.go', 'go/hummingbird/router_test.go', 'go/objectserver/backend_test.go', 'go/objectserver/main_test.go', 'go/client/directclient.go', 'go/objectserver/replicator_test.go', 'go/objectserver/replicator.go', 'go/hummingbird/router.go', 'go/objectserver/auditor.go', 'go/objectserver/update.go', 'go/objectserver/priorityrep.go', 'go/objectserver/repconn.go'], 'message': 'go: storage policies

This implements storage policies (as best I understand them).
It turned into a pretty big patch and changes a bunch of stuff.

There's a lot of plumbing of policies into functions that choose an
"objects" directory.

The replicator and auditor also handle any "replication" policies.
Those may get abstracted later on so you can register auditor and
replicator equivalents for non-replication object engines.

Request routing can take policies into account.  This is so that
something like "REPLICATE" calls can be routed to the correct object
engine, since they're instantiated per-policy.

They're instantiated per-policy so they can get the configs for their
policy, which swift doesn't really do, but I think could be useful.

Change-Id: Ia90664f9b178a29e1061bb03d0dd442ba6636c73
'}]
commit_message:
go: storage policies

This implements storage policies (as best I understand them).
It turned into a pretty big patch and changes a bunch of stuff.

There's a lot of plumbing of policies into functions that choose an
"objects" directory.

The replicator and auditor also handle any "replication" policies.
Those may get abstracted later on so you can register auditor and
replicator equivalents for non-replication object engines.

Request routing can take policies into account.  This is so that
something like "REPLICATE" calls can be routed to the correct object
engine, since they're instantiated per-policy.

They're instantiated per-policy so they can get the configs for their
policy, which swift doesn't really do, but I think could be useful.

Change-Id: Ia90664f9b178a29e1061bb03d0dd442ba6636c73

subject: Fix --type handling for indexing parent plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-15 14:38:16.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/functional/test_reindex.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_load.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_image_plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1584148-indexing-type-07ea84db2e6c1da4.yaml', 'searchlight/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_metadefs_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_plugin.py', 'searchlight/cmd/manage.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_glance_plugins.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/helper.py'], 'message': "Fix --type handling for indexing parent plugins

When --type is used to index a parent plugin, any child plugins are also
indexed from their APIs, and then the data's copied into the new index,
causing conflict errors. This patch simplifies indexing such that child
plugins are not indexed as a part of indexing the parent since the
reason for doing that in the past was refactored some time ago. Only
types specified in --type will be indexed from API; others from an old
index.

(See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295538/)

This patch removes initial_indexing since it no longer has use, and
renames setup_data to index_initial_data.

Patch also changes the index sync diagnostic text to indicate (with a *)
plugins which will be indexed from existing Elasticsearch data when
--type is specified.

Change-Id: Idbec6d3bf663cda7eeb6ab4be19b73d41fa2c8da
Closes-Bug: #1584148
"}]
commit_message:
Fix --type handling for indexing parent plugins

When --type is used to index a parent plugin, any child plugins are also
indexed from their APIs, and then the data's copied into the new index,
causing conflict errors. This patch simplifies indexing such that child
plugins are not indexed as a part of indexing the parent since the
reason for doing that in the past was refactored some time ago. Only
types specified in --type will be indexed from API; others from an old
index.

(See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295538/)

This patch removes initial_indexing since it no longer has use, and
renames setup_data to index_initial_data.

Patch also changes the index sync diagnostic text to indicate (with a *)
plugins which will be indexed from existing Elasticsearch data when
--type is specified.

Change-Id: Idbec6d3bf663cda7eeb6ab4be19b73d41fa2c8da
Closes-Bug: #1584148

commit_message:
Do not fail the playbook when libvirt network auto start fails

This is a workaround for the following error message.
'Requested operation is not valid: cannot set autostart for transient network'
This seems to occur mainly on RHEL virthosts and has not been very apparent
in ci.centos or traditional oooq deployments.

For more details see:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-quickstart/+bug/1581676

Related-Bug: 1581676

Change-Id: If1a59627c4c8a7d0bb6cf01b17853d5c5a295403

commit_message:
Add revision_number to standard attr for OVO

This adds the revision number field to the standard attributes
OVO code. All standard attribute OVO version numbers needed to
be bumped but the version numbers were kept the same since the
changed objects haven't been released yet.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: I864fe6964b32c7801465e8ebf45ce48f3e8e0cc9

commit_message:
Use plugins repo version of the human_log callback plugin

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/321331 the
human_log callback plugin is now part of the plugins repo.

This patch removes the retrofitted version in tox in favor of using
the version from the plugins repo instead.

commit_message:
delete stale ovsdb table entries from mysql db

whenever l2gateway_agnet.ini is reconfigured to the same ovsdb identifier
but different IP, then we need to clean the mysql db entries from earlier
configured ovsdb_identifier and IP.

For Ex: l2gateway_agent is connected to "ovsdb1:10.10.10.10:6632",
but when you change l2gateway_agent.ini to "ovsdb1:20.20.20.20:6632",
then the mysql entries related to "ovsdb1:10.10.10.10:6632" should be cleaned.

Change-Id: I72cd5a5e2ea27c2a6b37865c3517e614f901aecf
Closes-Bug:1588809
(cherry picked from commit af5c24232ee27aa9b5b4b5cf49046d1c889e89a4)

commit_message:
Remove 'nodes' key from serializer for 10.0

'nodes' data is deprecated so must be removed from 10.0 version
serializer output. The change was moved to separate serializer class in
order to maintain compatibility with previously deployed 9.0 clusters
after upgrade to 10.0.

Change-Id: I8fef591908cd8b1e4ace5502bb1e80cb37786c6e
Related-Bug: #1531128

subject: Add max_length to URIOpt
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-14 18:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/tests/test_types.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py', 'oslo_config/types.py'], 'message': 'Add max_length to URIOpt

Currently StrOpt has a max_length parameter to restrict the length
of the value, but URIOpt does not. The keystone project actually
has use for a max_length to restrict a URI used for the SAML2
entity ID.

Reference patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/341514

Change-Id: I39d012b0b7ebeddf6067016487ac8258461dda30
'}]
commit_message:
Add max_length to URIOpt

Currently StrOpt has a max_length parameter to restrict the length
of the value, but URIOpt does not. The keystone project actually
has use for a max_length to restrict a URI used for the SAML2
entity ID.

Reference patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/341514

Change-Id: I39d012b0b7ebeddf6067016487ac8258461dda30

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: gnocchi-install and gnocchi-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Documentation has been updated to inform how each tag
influences the function of the role.

Change-Id: Ie621d30c57d030577d7a1f01d2225ea4b17220a4

auth_token.CONF is simply the global oslo.config conf object linked into
the auth_token module. It is not intended for public use and has
recently been moved.

We can mock exactly the same entries without having to reach into
auth_token middleware and should do that instead.

"}]
commit_message:
Don't apply config fixture to auth_token.CONF

auth_token.CONF is simply the global oslo.config conf object linked into
the auth_token module. It is not intended for public use and has
recently been moved.

We can mock exactly the same entries without having to reach into
auth_token middleware and should do that instead.

* Also contains this change:
  Update quota_utils with import for keystone_auth
  Author: Ryan McNair <rdmcnair@us.ibm.com>
  Change-Id: I3ebb9979d37f62db161e2929fe2cff5a8ba2bf96
  (cherry picked from commit 4d66d2e833b86156e49ee34da49f7d6040945af1)
  Conflicts:
        cinder/quota_utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1600529
Change-Id: I5e8a481f37a7b409e491ce893a0e898d5085cc75
(cherry picked from commit 0bd4a6c286c9d867d04f77b17abf4862f3095742)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_quotas.py
	cinder/tests/unit/test_quota.py
	cinder/tests/unit/test_quota_utils.py

commit_message:
Add a py35 environment to tox

Infra will start running python35 jobs soon [1], targeting to replace
the current python34 jobs. This is due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty
to Xenial, where only python3.5 will be available.

Adding py35 environment to supported envlist.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/336272

Change-Id: I53801ba018a62e780c8ab66de51257fe019a99f0

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: designate-install and designate-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Documentation has been updated to inform how each tag
influences the function of the role.

Change-Id: I700b80bce2a8a761d341ca9cdc51398328966287

commit_message:
service validation: log output on failures

When validating a service, it's useful to have logs when exec output
fails.
This patch adds this feature.

Change-Id: I43c9eff8516ea562bf9bde8d5651ddceeb496163

commit_message:
Make rabbitmq inventory group configurable

The default value of "rabbitmq_all" remains, but this
change should allow deployers to target the role to multiple
groups now.

Change-Id: Idc1bc44b005f09f9dc7eb9778719a8ba92756c06
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 10:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinderclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix Unicode error printing extra-specs

If type-key is set to unicode the command cinder extra-specs-list
fails with the ERROR: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Id82bfbe8870351605f53c7ca029b9aa7e6089f6a
Closes-Bug: #1568937
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Unicode error printing extra-specs

If type-key is set to unicode the command cinder extra-specs-list
fails with the ERROR: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Id82bfbe8870351605f53c7ca029b9aa7e6089f6a
Closes-Bug: #1568937

subject: Make OSC nmi command 'inject nmi'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 15:32:25.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi.rst'], 'message': "Make OSC nmi command 'inject nmi'

This changes from 'inject_nmi' which doesn't feel right for an OSC
command, because it isn't just english words.

Change-Id: I466039fb7407e69e1375421594378a0a7bce1d7e
"}]
commit_message:
Make OSC nmi command 'inject nmi'

This changes from 'inject_nmi' which doesn't feel right for an OSC
command, because it isn't just english words.

Change-Id: I466039fb7407e69e1375421594378a0a7bce1d7e

commit_message:
Enhance Driver Interface for Soft Power Off and Inject NMI

This specification proposes the work required to enhance the driver
interface to support soft power off and diagnostic interrupt (NMI [1]),
and the work required to provide ipmitool reference implementation.

[1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-maskable_interrupt

Change-Id: I3dc6561ea7cecf8b8d998717fefa9cf8001d0f4c
Partial-Bug: #1526226

subject: Always run linters for OpenStack-Ansible jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 11:05:42.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Always run linters for OpenStack-Ansible jobs

Currently any changes in the docs/releasenotes folders do not get
lint checked. While this is generally fine, the sphinx configuration
should be lint checked.

This patch ensures that the 'linters' check runs against any
documentation/releasenotes changes to ensure that this is covered.

Change-Id: I012756f08d52b9757b36912a66154dd42ae0afbe
"}]
commit_message:
Always run linters for OpenStack-Ansible jobs

Currently any changes in the docs/releasenotes folders do not get
lint checked. While this is generally fine, the sphinx configuration
should be lint checked.

This patch ensures that the 'linters' check runs against any
documentation/releasenotes changes to ensure that this is covered.

Change-Id: I012756f08d52b9757b36912a66154dd42ae0afbe

commit_message:
Quota Update

Exposes the existing Quotas.update call in the management API to
the user API and implements a corresponding shell command.  Admin
privileges will be required to execute the command.

Change-Id: I7cc19a9d2c034bb4b0695cacf7e1bc18a4fd999f

commit_message:
Added tests for "cluster template" and "cluster" commands for Sahara CLI

Tests for "cluster-template" command include their creating, updating,
showing, deleting and list of all cluster templates. Tests for "cluster"
command include create, update, delete and list commands. Also test
for node group creating was updated.

Change-Id: I4bc4b089f2cde8052aa20d1772d5a0530540067e

Change-Id: Ie8ceb501f81a1a4b3d22adc28b4507f618fd92d7

commit_message:
Modifying call to initActions() to match Horizon

registry.initActions() is moving to the resource type, so in this patch
we adapt by fetching the type (and if it's not present, no harm done) and
calling initActions() on it.

Also accommodating removal of .format() from ResourceType and renaming
of other functions.

Change-Id: Ie8ceb501f81a1a4b3d22adc28b4507f618fd92d7
Depends-On: I1b80971a4b19f26455dfc568de6bbb36b1245ef3
Closes-Bug: 1593795

commit_message:
Use plugins repo version of the human_log callback plugin

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/321331 the
human_log callback plugin is now part of the plugins repo.

This patch removes the retrofitted version in tox in favor of using
the version from the plugins repo instead.

commit_message:
Use plugins repo version of the human_log callback plugin

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/321331 the
human_log callback plugin is now part of the plugins repo.

This patch removes the retrofitted version in tox in favor of using
the version from the plugins repo instead.

Change-Id: I7db2a37ae62d20f2ac2711877210a6c439aa612f

subject: add email notifications for release-post queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 14:54:33.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "add email notifications for release-post queue

When tags are being proposed by a job running in the post queue, we'll
want to monitor that job for failures. Set up the release-post queue to
use the same email notification that we have for the tag queue.

Change-Id: I045db9173938fbbcaf6c708cfb4677b8122acbf8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
add email notifications for release-post queue

When tags are being proposed by a job running in the post queue, we'll
want to monitor that job for failures. Set up the release-post queue to
use the same email notification that we have for the tag queue.

Change-Id: I045db9173938fbbcaf6c708cfb4677b8122acbf8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
install tempest-horizon from source

Tempest test for Horizon moved from Tempest to a dedicated plugin,
called tempest-horizon. The plugin is currently not packaged in RDO or
UCA but will be soon.
Until this time, deploy the plugin from source.

Change-Id: I509c044a874b77ae0f26d6c7938869fb0c492d87

subject: Add bandit to pep8 venv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 20:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add bandit to pep8 venv

Bandit is considered a linter much like pep8. So by request from
the infra team, the bandit job is being made part of pep8 venv.
The bandit testenv needs to stay however for the bandit integration
job.

Change-Id: I83d27217a9ffe8a882342442072272a250eb818c
'}]
commit_message:
Add bandit to pep8 venv

Bandit is considered a linter much like pep8. So by request from
the infra team, the bandit job is being made part of pep8 venv.
The bandit testenv needs to stay however for the bandit integration
job.

Change-Id: I83d27217a9ffe8a882342442072272a250eb818c

subject: Add options for configuring file limits in swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 16:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/swift_storage_hosts_setup.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-fs-file-limits-a57ab8b4c3c944e4.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/swift_pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Add options for configuring file limits in swift

Options have been added to allow a deployer to control the
hard, soft, and fs.file-max limits on swift specific nodes.

Change-Id: Ia5dd51fa360745a9776d58d0bf49d8e1201d3139
Closes-Bug: #1595290
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 022b62fc8dd7e69adb8cce2858c3203ff81a131b)

subject: force a fuller update of the repo being cloned for tagging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 20:37:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/functions'], 'message': "force a fuller update of the repo being cloned for tagging

zuul-cloner may be using an out of date cache, and may have pointed
originally at a repo on a zuul merger that doesn't have all tags. Force
an update of all remotes and fetch all tags to make sure they are
present before we start trying to add any new ones.

Change-Id: I29cdae3ff8195e4b7e35ac486429394f17919bff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
force a fuller update of the repo being cloned for tagging

zuul-cloner may be using an out of date cache, and may have pointed
originally at a repo on a zuul merger that doesn't have all tags. Force
an update of all remotes and fetch all tags to make sure they are
present before we start trying to add any new ones.

Change-Id: I29cdae3ff8195e4b7e35ac486429394f17919bff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Override install_command in neutron unit tests for periodic queue

Otherwise the command that tries to install upper-constraints is picked
up, and that makes the local and global requirements on neutron-lib clash.

Change-Id: Iba6161497bd7d2152d48fdcf77edfb17893a4232

subject: [CI Fix] Hotfix for stable/liberty jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 17565, 'name': 'IBM GPFS CI', 'email': 'imanilac@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmmanilaci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-15 02:03:05.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/ci/pre_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "[CI Fix] Hotfix for stable/liberty jobs

Tempest is branchless, but highly tempestuous in itself.
We have had many breakages in the manila stable branch jobs
because of changes made to the clients that we use for tempest.
This led us to pin a particular commit of tempest. However, when
the changes made to tempest are taken to stable branches of
devstack in any form [1], our stable branch jobs are no longer
protected by the 'stable' commit that we checkout. Without
bringing in the horde of changes to our stable branch, we could
cherry-pick the offending tempest change [2] on top of the
existing 'stable' commit.

[1] I63658b8d8dfa999e0feb79f8f2968f2b32e3ff57
[2] Iab2e6e04b6c5795a4d0c8214564106525b942308

Closes-Bug: #1603275

Change-Id: I4248c704256fc790082f3ac2515c6445ac7aa78a
"}]
commit_message:
[CI Fix] Hotfix for stable/liberty jobs

Tempest is branchless, but highly tempestuous in itself.
We have had many breakages in the manila stable branch jobs
because of changes made to the clients that we use for tempest.
This led us to pin a particular commit of tempest. However, when
the changes made to tempest are taken to stable branches of
devstack in any form [1], our stable branch jobs are no longer
protected by the 'stable' commit that we checkout. Without
bringing in the horde of changes to our stable branch, we could
cherry-pick the offending tempest change [2] on top of the
existing 'stable' commit.

[1] I63658b8d8dfa999e0feb79f8f2968f2b32e3ff57
[2] Iab2e6e04b6c5795a4d0c8214564106525b942308

Closes-Bug: #1603275

Change-Id: I4248c704256fc790082f3ac2515c6445ac7aa78a

commit_message:
[Monasca-agent] Remove check-requirements check job for monasca-agent

Remove this CI job because there are libraries such as tornado and
supervisor that we can not get into global requirements. Needs more
work on monasca-agent before we can make it into projects.txt

Change-Id: Ib758cb864835a04ece4c7ff70df359740bb50dd1

subject: Revert "Disable all gate jobs for fuel-mirror master"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:19:12.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Disable all gate jobs for fuel-mirror master"

This reverts commit b42f1f3af329c1da1bebaff0709da35c2a6c3210.

It turned out that disabling all gate jobs also disables us to merge any patches in master to the directory which is still needed. So the best way is to leave pep8 jobs for master and have fake tox target for pep8.

Change-Id: Icfe4f78f4bee7afeecbfef07fb5331d95f4e963c
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Disable all gate jobs for fuel-mirror master"

This reverts commit b42f1f3af329c1da1bebaff0709da35c2a6c3210.

It turned out that disabling all gate jobs also disables us to merge any patches in master to the directory which is still needed. So the best way is to leave pep8 jobs for master and have fake tox target for pep8.

Change-Id: Icfe4f78f4bee7afeecbfef07fb5331d95f4e963c

commit_message:
[mistral] Add check-requirements to mistral-extra

This resource will be used in both the overcloud and the undercloud,

commit_message:
Add resource for requesting certificates for HAProxy

This resource will be used in both the overcloud and the undercloud,
and can be called in several instances (for public-facing or
internal-facing certificates).

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I0410fe0dbbed97d16909e911f7318d78a5bd7d7b

subject: Correct domain parameter value in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Correct domain parameter value in tests

Previously in tests keystone client method for user creation was called
with domain equal to 'Default', as far as it was supposed to refer to
domain name. However, it really refers to domain id, so value should be
replaced with 'default'.

Closes-Bug:#1603431

Change-Id: Ic7693d74a0ea1a9cdd789d5adc61b07516ac5918
"}]
commit_message:
Correct domain parameter value in tests

Previously in tests keystone client method for user creation was called
with domain equal to 'Default', as far as it was supposed to refer to
domain name. However, it really refers to domain id, so value should be
replaced with 'default'.

Closes-Bug:#1603431

Change-Id: Ic7693d74a0ea1a9cdd789d5adc61b07516ac5918

subject: Prints '-' instead of 'None' when data is None
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-10 12:07:58.000000000', 'files': ['barbicanclient/cas.py', 'barbicanclient/acls.py', 'barbicanclient/containers.py', 'barbicanclient/tests/test_acls.py', 'barbicanclient/orders.py', 'barbicanclient/secrets.py'], 'message': "Prints '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I90bf30635f6add5be40b6f7df48b1bd6bb370160
"}]
commit_message:
Prints '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: I90bf30635f6add5be40b6f7df48b1bd6bb370160

commit_message:
Added ability use variables from environment

Now we can export variables for scenario tests or specify
them via flags in run-command. Credentials.yaml is removed.

closes-bug: #1558994
bp: use-env-variables

Change-Id: I64983028ad88f654e9d0ee7147cfd0f16d6ddbe7

subject: Make the field empty instead of outputing 'None'
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-12 11:53:35.000000000', 'files': ['osc_lib/utils.py', 'osc_lib/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Make the field empty instead of outputing 'None'

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clarify the confusion, Client should make the field empty
instead of outputing 'None'. Nova Client and Cinder Client has
clarified the confusion.

Change-Id: I7e3a965e6ae67152bb9ec6ae1a8a3d16287784bd
Related-Bug: #1600556
"}]
commit_message:
Make the field empty instead of outputing 'None'

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clarify the confusion, Client should make the field empty
instead of outputing 'None'. Nova Client and Cinder Client has
clarified the confusion.

Change-Id: I7e3a965e6ae67152bb9ec6ae1a8a3d16287784bd
Related-Bug: #1600556

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience
py35 venv.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 01:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['manila/utils.py'], 'message': 'timeutils.total_seconds() is deprecated

This deprecated func is going to be removed starting with 3.1 version of
"oslo_utils" because the datetime.total_seconds() has been deprecated for
python >= 2.6,and is replaced by datetime.timedelta.total_seconds.

Change-Id: Ie75a3afcba0dda2a9e7c3da71e055c3d505efd62
'}]
commit_message:
timeutils.total_seconds() is deprecated

This deprecated func is going to be removed starting with 3.1 version of
"oslo_utils" because the datetime.total_seconds() has been deprecated for
python >= 2.6,and is replaced by datetime.timedelta.total_seconds.

Change-Id: Ie75a3afcba0dda2a9e7c3da71e055c3d505efd62

commit_message:
Prints  '-' instead of 'None' at print_dict()

1. Currently Cinder client output '-' instead of 'None' at print_list()，
   we should output '-' instead of 'None' at print_dict() too.
2. Add unit test fot it.

Change-Id: Ia84e6e5de62f1e8762c75d5606440378f9e3fc28

commit_message:
Apply SSH security settings from UI

This commit change restriction for SSH access only from networks
provided on UI instead of all local networks by default.

DocImpact

subject: Do not raise NotFound for resource_get_all_* queries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 05:54:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Do not raise NotFound for resource_get_all_* queries

A stack with zero resources is not an exception worthy condition (for
example, a stack being deleted, a stack which really does have zero
resources).

Also its unusual that a collection query function would raise a
NotFound when the result count is zero.

This change fixes that for resource_get_all_by_stack and
resource_get_all_active_by_stack

Change-Id: I3420d5099830f5626095b17c01e9d886b477915c
Related-Bug: #1301320
Related-Bug: #1523748
'}]
commit_message:
Do not raise NotFound for resource_get_all_* queries

A stack with zero resources is not an exception worthy condition (for
example, a stack being deleted, a stack which really does have zero
resources).

Also its unusual that a collection query function would raise a
NotFound when the result count is zero.

This change fixes that for resource_get_all_by_stack and
resource_get_all_active_by_stack

Change-Id: I3420d5099830f5626095b17c01e9d886b477915c
Related-Bug: #1301320
Related-Bug: #1523748

subject: Support charm upgrades to new OS release
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-15 09:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_charm.py', 'unit_tests/__init__.py', 'README.md', 'charms_openstack/charm.py'], 'message': "Support charm upgrades to new OS release

An OpenStack principle charm has an 'openstack-origin' configruation option.
This is used to setup the package source for a charm. If a user updates this
option to point at a package repository then the charm can be configured to
automatically upgrade. This patch adds support for this upgrade scenario.

Change-Id: I3a967b8a8f27e9fd1dd5ab0e5e9e110132308d42
"}]
commit_message:
Support charm upgrades to new OS release

An OpenStack principle charm has an 'openstack-origin' configruation option.
This is used to setup the package source for a charm. If a user updates this
option to point at a package repository then the charm can be configured to
automatically upgrade. This patch adds support for this upgrade scenario.

Change-Id: I3a967b8a8f27e9fd1dd5ab0e5e9e110132308d42

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 06:22:22.000000000', 'files': ['saharaclient/osc/v1/node_group_templates.py', 'saharaclient/osc/v1/cluster_templates.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rename_version_to_plugin-version-20cfe17530446391.yaml', 'saharaclient/osc/v1/job_types.py', 'saharaclient/osc/v1/plugins.py', 'saharaclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_node_group_templates.py', 'saharaclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_plugins.py', 'saharaclient/osc/v1/clusters.py', 'saharaclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_cluster_templates.py', 'saharaclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_clusters.py', 'saharaclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_job_types.py'], 'message': "Change plugin version 'version' parameter to 'plugin-version'

Currently we have parameter 'version' for specifying plugin version
for creating node group templates and also for listing available
plugins. The problem is that this parameter is global parameter for
getting version of client. So, this patch fixes this confusion.

Change-Id: I89a670188c20e3b20b98b596a3efb8d5997c3214
Closes-bug: #1565775
(cherry picked from commit f02ea8999c79ea9a3e1f515220775bc54838f9d2)
"}]
commit_message:
Change plugin version 'version' parameter to 'plugin-version'

Currently we have parameter 'version' for specifying plugin version
for creating node group templates and also for listing available
plugins. The problem is that this parameter is global parameter for
getting version of client. So, this patch fixes this confusion.

Change-Id: I89a670188c20e3b20b98b596a3efb8d5997c3214
Closes-bug: #1565775
(cherry picked from commit f02ea8999c79ea9a3e1f515220775bc54838f9d2)

commit_message:
Replaced asserts in tests with more specific ones

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*)
or assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type)

The code gets more readable, and a better description will
be shown on fail.

Change-Id: Ife823047a0c086b625c973822c39ac3933e6f67d
